intro: Haploclathra paniculata, commonly known as the panicled haploclathra, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, clustered white flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy surface. Haploclathra paniculata is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
